Deficiency Narrative: Two employee files did not have pre-employment affidavit form 2912 documentation.
2 of 2 CPR training documents did not have length of training in hours.
Correction Narrative: RCCR received the following response from the operation: The Training department will make sure all training certificates have length of training hours.

Deficiency Narrative: 1 of 2 staff files did not have the Licensed Affidavit notarized.
Correction Narrative: RCCR received a notarized affidavit for the employee involved. The operation submitted the following response: H.R. department will audit all new hires files to make sure (the operation) is meeting job requirements before new hires starts on boarding process.

Deficiency Narrative: 1 of 2 staff files did not have  tuberculosis screening  results documented.
Correction Narrative: RCCR received a copy of an employees tuberculosis screening via email. The operation submitted the following response: H.R. department will audit all new hires files to make sure (the operation) is meeting job requirements before new hires starts on boarding process.

Deficiency Narrative: 1 of 2 files did not have education provided to support the employee meets the qualifications.
Correction Narrative: RCCR received education documentation for an employee that matches the employees job description.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation will to retrain staff memebers on debreifing with children.
Correction Narrative:
On 5/3/2024, the operation submitted a sign up sheet with staff members who attended the training. The training does not include documentation to support unauthorized absences training. Follow up is needed with staff members. 

Follow-up was completed during the inspection on 5/22/2204. During the inspection 2 staff interviewed indicate staff members were trained on debriefing with children who runaway by asking the child why they ran, what coping skills can be used next time and questions if anything took place while away from the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: 2 of 2 refrigerators did not have a thermometer
1 of 2 child files reviewed did not have a debrief with child following a unauthorized absence.
1 of 2 files did not have education provided to support the employee meets the qualifications. The file is also missing documentation to support minimum experience with children.
5 of 6 medication logs did not display the reason the medication was prescribed.
5 of 6 medication logs did not have health-care professionals name.
During the walk through, a hole was seen behind a door.
Correction Narrative: During the walk through, a hole was observed to be filled in RESET program.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was discovered that the operation does not report any unauthorized absences of children who are private placements.
Correction Narrative: The operation made an intake regarding a run away child. Intake number and documentation was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: One child in care did not recieve their prescribed medication as directed.
Correction Narrative:
1) The 1st caregiver on duty will administer medications and complete a pill count of the medication and sign the medication log for accuracy.
2) The 2nd caregiver on duty will complete an audit of the pill count for accuracy and sign the Medication of sheet, after the 1st caregiver on duty has completed administering medication.
3) If there is not a 2nd caregiver on duty, the Lead Direct Care staff complete the audit of the pill count for accuracy and sing the Medication log.
4)The Lead Direct Care staff will do a daily audit of the Medication logs for accuracy.
5) The case Managers will complete weekly audit of the medications log sheet.
During Inspection on 10/25/2023 we saw it being applied.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver did not use self-control when she snatched a phone out of child's hand, causing the child to escalate grab a fire extinguisher and set it off inside the cottage house.
Correction Narrative:
To achieve improvement, staff will demonstrate the 3 R's, relationship, regulation, and de-escalation. Directors will ensure staff receive a refresher to alter the youth's emotional and physical state when they are exhibiting verbal and or aggressive behaviors.

On 10/25/2023 a follow up inspection was conducted. Documentation was reviewed regarding crisis intervention response training for both staff members. Documentation indicates a meeting was conducted with both staff members related to strategies to de-escalate children verbally. The fire extinguisher was installed in a safer place but still accessible to staff members.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver was not paying attention to a child in care, allowing the child to gain access to a fire extinguisher, sit it on the table, figure out how to engage the fire extinguisher and then use it to spray another caregiver without warning.
Correction Narrative:
To achieve improvement, staff will provide active and engaging supervision. Staff must be in close range and have visibility of youth. Staff will ensure youth are in line of sight and provide 10Â–15-minute checks. Directors will ensure staff maintain their Managing Aggressive Behavior training every six months and/or provide refreshers as needed. 
During the Inspection on 10/25/2023 during our walk through we saw the form that is being used in the 10-15 minutes check.

Deficiency Narrative: Documentation of severe weather drill was not produced during the inspection.

A child file was reviewed and did  not have the reason of why the child was placed in emergency care. The file was also missing the child's understanding or need for placement and child feels about crisis situation/operation.
2 of 2 files did not provide the child with information on making reports to outside agencies.
a file that was reviewed did not have an employee s high school diploma or any verification that they completed high school.
The operation was not completing the place extension documentation by the timeframe required.
1 child file reviewed did not include the date the child was notified of the discharge.

Caregivers did not follow a child's safety plan requirements. Requirements state the child will remain within line of sight during waking hours and staff will ensure no other residents are down the hall when the child is goes to the bathroom.
A child's service plan was not signed by the child or any members of the service planning team.
Correction Narrative: Operation director emailed me the service plan signed by all participants in the service planning team.

Deficiency Narrative:
A caregiver did not follow the operation's procedures when they took six children in care on an outing after being told they could only take three. 
The operation's management staff provided the caregiver with verbal counseling on 8/2/2022 and a written final warning for not following directions of the management staff and placing children at risk.

Of the three initial service plans reviewed, none of the plans state specific supervision requirements based on the child's age, behaviors, and level of care. The information in all three service plans appear to be copied and pasted. All three service plans are missing signatures from the service plan team and only contain the signatures of the children.
Correction Narrative: At the time the investigation was complete, the children were discharged, and no corrections could be made.

Deficiency Narrative: During an outing, four of six children were separated and out of sight of the caregiver which resulted in two children being caught shoplifting and law enforcement being called.
Correction Narrative: A follow-up inspection is planned for 11/10/2022. The caregiver no longer works at the operation as of 11/10/22.

Deficiency Narrative:
A caregiver admitted to using profane language in the presence of the children in care. The caregiver was also yelling at a child in care. 
The operation's management staff provided the caregiver with verbal counseling on 8/2/2022 and a written final warning for using inappropriate language in the presence of children.
Correction Narrative:
A follow-up inspection is planned for 11/10/2022.

RCCR completed a follow-up inspection on 11/10/22. During the inspection it was learned that a staff member had used inappropriate language with a new group of children in care. After speaking with the operation, it was confirmed that the staff will no longer be working with the operation going forward. A report was called into the abuse hotline on 11/10/22. Report # 76946635. As of 11/10/22, The staff member is not an active employee of the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: A child with a history of cutting self harmed 7/16/22 and on 7/31/22. This was after a safety plan was implemented on 7/6/22.
On 7/31/22 after staff was made aware of the first self harming incident, the child was left unattended and self harmed again with objects in the environment.
4 out of 6 child files reviewed did not have a dental examination record.
2 out of 6 child files reviewed did not have a medical examination record.
A caregiver slept while counted in the child care ratio.
Correction Narrative: A detailed plan was emailed to RCCR Inspector JerSean Walder. JonathanÂ’s Place is updating the overnight monitoring procedure to include bed check documentation on the electronic monitoring system in extendedReach.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection 1 out of 3 cottages homes had an uncovered piece of cake in the freezer.
Psychotropic medication (Sertraline) was stored in an unlock storage box.  Corrected during inspection.  Pictures were taken.
